# Subsetting the data

## Rename a column


```{python}
# df.rename({"Life expectancy (years)": "Life_yrs"})


#an alternative way
df.columns = ["Entity", "Code", "Year", "Life_yrs"]

```


## Subset columns using filter()


```{python}
df.select("Entity")
df.select(["Entity", "Year", "Life_yrs"])

df.drop('Code')

df.select(pl.col("Life_yrs") * 12)
#moral of the story: if it's not working, try putting the column name in pl.col()

df_col3 = df.drop("Code")
```


# Subsetting rows using filter()

### filtering numeric data



```{python}
df.filter(pl.col("Year") > 1999)

df.filter(pl.col("Year") >= 1980, pl.col("Year") <= 2000)
df.filter((pl.col("Year") >= 1980) & (pl.col("Year") <= 2000))


```


### filtering on character strings

```{python}
df.filter(pl.col("Entity") ==  "China")
# 1 out of 10, would not recommend


# df.filter((pl.col("Entity") == "China") | 
#          (pl.col("Entity") == "Japan") | 
#          (pl.col("Entity") == "Cuba"))


# Faster

jcc = df.filter(pl.col("Entity").is_in(["China", "Japan", "Cuba"]))


```

## sorting the data

```{python}
# Example 

(
jcc.drop("Code")
    .sort(["Year", "Life_yrs"], descending=[False, True])
    .tail(10)
)
```
